content:
Is the documentation at https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/FHIR+Spreadsheet+Authoring#FHIRSpreadsheetAuthoring-BindingsTab right?
The column names match the exam ple in sample-ig but I was looking at US Core as an example and that one uses "extensible" as a value in the Conformance column and has a max-valueset column where the sample-ig has the Extensible column.
but that documentation is for resources (base build) not profiles in spreadsheets
extensible is a valid value in either case though
oh, i thought this doc covered spreadsheet profile authoring too (e.g. it says this column is for "Profile-only")
i do see the separate page for spreadsheet profile authoring, but I had assumed that one was just about the structure tab (e.g. nothing about Bindings on that one)

anyway, I guess I'll add "extensible" as an allowed value on this page.
And as for this new "max-valueset" column I see in US Core, is it safe to assume the tool doesn't do anything with that? Like its just ignored I guess and the real "max-valueset" is computed automatically based on whether the profiled element had a required binding?
no. if the value is extensible, then the max-valueset column will be checked

OK, here is my proposed wiki changes based on this info.

  1. add "extensible" as allowed value for Conformance; with a description like "systems SHALL use the codes specified if applicable"
  2. remove "Extensible" column; it becomes an allowed value in the Conformance column instead of its own separate boolean
  3. add the definition of a new column: max-valueset (Profile-only) with a description like "The maximum allowable value set, for use when the binding strength is 'extensible' or 'preferred'"

does it sound right? if so, i'll go make those edits now
